programme.title: Blue World S6 - "Night Diving With Sharks"
programme.desc: Blue World hooks up with famous YouTube animal expert Coyote Peterson and takes him, and his crew, on their first shark dive…with massive Tiger Sharks!

programme.title: Blue World S6 - "Hammerhead Sharks in the Bahamas"
programme.desc: We experience Great Hammerhead sharks that often like to swim very close to divers. Then Blue World divers play a game of “keep away” with a pod of wild Spotted Dolphins.

programme.title: Super Senses 2: Special Forces S1 - "SPECIAL GEAR"
programme.desc: On the savannah, in the forest, or under the sea, the competition never quits. Having the right gear provides more than a fighting chance for success.

programme.title: Wild Animal Rescue S1 - "Restaurant Bears and The Last Wild Horses"
programme.sub-title: Restaurant Bears and The Last Wild Horses
programme.desc: Locked in small cages and used as attractions at small private zoos and even local restaurants, the future of 15 Kosovo bears is bleak if animal rescue organisation FOUR PAWS doesn’t take action.

programme.title: Wild Animal Rescue S1 - "Plight of the Lions"
programme.desc: We follow FOUR PAWS’ efforts to give captive lions a better life. A family of five lions who suffered a harsh life in a Romanian zoo, are given a new home, and a new lease on life; and we take a look at a shocking, yet legal industry.

programme.title: Ocean Vet S1 - "Diaries"
programme.desc: The crew look back and reveal their favourite moments, close calls and toughest challenges, and we discover just exactly what it took for Neil to become Bermuda’s Ocean Vet.

programme.title: Wild Iberia S1 - "Winter"
programme.desc: The unknown face of Spain. Snow, rain, clouds and cold envelop the land. The ibex migrate to the valleys, and wolves patrol the mountains as vultures circle the skies overhead.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Alien in the Pond"
programme.desc: An alien world of bizzare creatures exists in the surface film of most lakes and ponds - tiny insects, with incredible capabilities, locked in a life and death struggle to survive.

programme.title: Life of Cards S1 - "Nicolau Villa-Lobos"
programme.desc: Carefree Sunday child Nicolau Villa-Lobos who encountered bad luck and turned it into a new career.

programme.title: Life of Cards S1 - "Vanessa Selbst"
programme.desc: Vanessa Selbst, one of the most successful and skillful female poker player looks beyond the poker scene and aspires a new career.

programme.title: Life of Cards S1 - "Liv Boeree"
programme.desc: Astrophysicist, model and metalhead Liv Boeree who reached for the stars and became a poker celebrity.

programme.title: The Flying Kestrel S1 - "Record Day - Part 2"
programme.desc: The Flying Kestrel takes on the final records attempts, and the shocking results leave everyone reeling.

programme.title: The Flying Kestrel S2 - "The Crash"
programme.desc: After driver Jon Webster crashes the Flying Kestrel at 148 mph, the team must work out what went wrong and have to decide if the dream of a land speed record is worth risking it all?

programme.title: The Flying Kestrel S2 - "The Rebuild"
programme.desc: The Flying Kestrel team regroup at Jon’s workshop as he shows them his new groundbreaking ideas to rebuild the car to give them the best chance at breaking a land speed record.

programme.title: The Flying Kestrel S2 - "The Test"
programme.desc: The new version of the Flying Kestrel is ready to be put to the test at one of the most state of the art wind tunnels. Has the team done enough to create a record-breaking car?

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "Hyperloop"
programme.desc: Virgin Hyperloop is a train that runs inside a steel tunnel. This revolutionary new vehicle floats along the track using magnetic levitation and glides at airline speeds.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "The Race to Space"
programme.desc: A new era of space, where small satellites no bigger than a showbox will be deployed not in one or twos, but in their thousands, referred to as satellite swarms.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "Perpetual Power"
programme.desc: All over the world, engineers and scientists are racing to solve one key problem: how to safely and efficiently store electricity at a huge scale but at a low cost.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "Timber Skyscraper"
programme.desc: This film explores the mind-blowing world of timber buildings for a more sustainable future.

programme.title: Speed S1 - "Across Oceans"
programme.desc: Throughout history, human society has run on trade. The innovations that allowed faster and more accurate oceanic travel revolutionized the world. New inventions now help people and goods move on the water faster for recreation and commerce.

programme.title: Speed S1 - "Across Continents"
programme.desc: Never in the history of humanity have so many of us been mobile. New innovations propel us into the world of self-driving cars and high-speed trains.

programme.title: Speed S1 - "Into the Skies"
programme.desc: Growth in air transportation is set to soar, carrying over 10 billion passengers every year by 2050. To cope requires us to radically rethink aircraft design. Join us as we look into the world's most innovative research and development labs.

programme.title: Speed S1 - "Into Space"
programme.desc: The most innovative area of human motion lies not on Earth, but with the exploration of space. Meet the private space entrepreneurs jostling to offer the tantalizing prospect of cheap, frequent travel beyond the atmosphere into Earth orbit.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Bear Attack"
programme.desc: Nick and Laura create kick-ass tests to explore the immense power and startling speed of grizzly bears. They use Hollywood stunt tools to experience an attack. Then try to recreate a “miracle” arrow shot that saved a man from being killed by a bear.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving Treestand Accidents"
programme.desc: In this exciting episode we’ll find out the reasons why tree stand accidents happen and how we can prevent them. Cool science mixed with dynamic experiments send our hosts, our stunt team and our special crash test dummies plummeting to the ground.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Sniper Attack"
programme.desc: Military snipers are trained in a variety of skills: detection, stalking, camouflage, infiltration, special reconnaissance and target acquisition. Bottom line, a ton of cool shooting and science for Nick and Laura to explore!

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Lightning Strike"
programme.desc: Laura and Nick travel to a state-of-the-art Direct Effects Lightning Test Lab. With some “explosive” experiments, they’ll determine the power lightning and how it behaves? And they’ll find out how can hunters and fishermen best protect themselves?

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "China"
programme.desc: We visit China's most famous Wind and Rain Bridge and the Ponte dei Salti in the Verzasca Valley that literally dates back to the Roman era.

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "Wales"
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in the south of France is one of the highest bridge structures in the world while the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct, which stands high over the River Dee in northeast Wales, was built in the 19th century.

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "India"
programme.desc: One of the most impressive steel bridges in the world can be found in Calcutta: the Howrah Bridge. Its predecessor is the Forth Bridge across the Firth of Forth, near the Scottish capital of Edinburgh.

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "Zimbabwe"
programme.desc: The Great Seto Bridge in Japan and the Victoria Falls Bridge in Zimbabwe have more than one thing in common: they were built on dreams and are the only train connections between the two regions.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S3 - "Zhang Heng's Seismometer"
programme.desc: Witness the recreation of a 2,000-year-old earthquake alarm that, if effective, could have saved the lives of thousands.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S3 - "Battering Ram"
programme.desc: The invention of the battering ram was a breakthrough thousands of years ago, but does it still pack a punch?

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S3 - "Chinese War Kite"
programme.desc: Join Matt and Jeremy as they combine 13th century Chinese fire arrow technology with a 17th century Japanise kite design to see if they can command the battlefield with this amazing device.
